metadata.Title: CVE-2019-8325 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in RubyGems 2.6 and later through 3.0.2. Since Gem::CommandManager#run calls alert_error without escaping, escape sequence injection is possible. (There are many ways to cause an error.) It was discovered that Gem::CommandMangert#run failed to escape certain characters. An attacker could use this vulnerability inject escape sequences into a victim's terminal.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8325` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

jruby - 9.1.17.0-3
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> ruby{1.9.1,2.0,2.3} and jruby ship an embedded rubygems.

criterions.comment: jruby package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.1.17.0-3').
